data.title: Blake Nemec
data.text:
Open Door, Author Reading, Poetry Foundation, Chicago, IL, Dec 2022

Somatics Writing Workshop for Writing Teachers, Young Chicago Authors, Chicago, IL, August 2022

Somatics Writing Workshop, Chop Wood Carry Water, IL, August 2022

Mercury; Covid Conversations as Dance Music, Santa Fe, NM, June 2021

Somatics Writing as Prism to World Building Workshop, Woodland Pattern Bookstore, July 2021

Somatics to Drawing Workshop, Spudnik Press, Chicago, IL, Jan 2021

Visiting Sound Recorder Artist, San Francisco State, Online, Oct 2020

Critique Week Panel Member, visiting writer, School of the Art Institute of Chicago, Chicago, IL, Dec 2020, 2019, 2018

MolyBDenim Project as Noise or Transformative Melody. SoundWeb Symposium, Vancouver, BC, May 2019

Coming Around: Urban vs. Pastoral Idiom Transluciferations, Meekling Press, Chicago, IL, 2018

Does an Unbuilt Monument Cast a Shadow, performance w/ Emilio Rojas Chicago Arts Center, Chicago, IL, Oct 2018

The Sonic Intimacies of Worker Dialogues Workshop. Allied Media Conference. Detroit, MI June 2016

MolyBDenim & the Sonic Intimacies of Worker Dialogues. ENTITLE Political Ecology Conference. Stockholm, Sweden. March 2016

Social Movements Oral History Intersections with New Media. Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Boston, MA May 2014

​Hybrid poetry/fiction Workshop. Columbia College of Chicago. October 2013

​Facilitated six week writing workshops for fiction and poetry writers. San Francisco & Oakland, CA 2006-2009

​Teaching Mutt Lit: Genre-Benders, Hybrids, and Other Weirdness in the Creative Writing Classroom. American Writer’s Programs. Boston, MA March 2012

World Perspectives of Literature with LGBTQ+ Emphasis, Harold Washington & Harry S. Truman College. Surveys national and international literature within feminist and postcolonial frameworks in both online interface writing and zoom class discussion. Remote learning. Dec 2022 – present.

World Perspectives of Cinema with LGBTQ+ Emphasis, Harold Washington & Harry S. Truman College. Surveys national and international film within feminist and postcolonial frameworks in both online interface writing and zoom class discussion. Remote learning. March 2020 – present.

English Language Instructor for International ELL Adult Students, Online, May 2017 – May 2019.

Stories Create History; Power, Narration and the Framing of LGBTQ Events, Women & Gender Studies Department; Blackboard and Moodle Lecturer, Designed online instructional curricula; excavation of politics of narration, University of Texas, ​El Paso, Tx, August 2014 – December 2015

Writing Coach, Short story and poetry project support of creative writers via one-on-one video, email, or word processing interfaces, August 2012 – present
